description:
Do you want to be part of the team that brings world class hardware from concept to market? The Design for Excellence (DfX) team within Microsoft's NPI group enables the delivery of world class hardware that our customers love, incorporating innovative, cutting edge technologies.
 Role & Opportunity:
The Microsoft New Product Introduction (NPI) group is looking for a passionate & team-oriented engineer to join us in shaping the future of devices. 
 You will be part of the Design for Manufacturing (DfM) group within the DfX team and focused on PCB's and FPC's design and manufacturing processes. Your end-to-end engagement will include design development, new design and process characterization, and manufacturing launch of next generation Microsoft hardware. You will get to collaborate cross-functionally with engineering disciplines across the company.
responsibilities:
Integral technical engagement and concurrent engineering collaboration with internal product development groups such as Surface, Surface Hub, Xbox, HoloLens and Next Generation product lines
Early partnership with product development teams to identify design elements that are new, unique, or difficult and enable their realization through all engineering verification and validation cycles.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and external vendors to identify, characterize and deliver manufacturing processes that enable the commercialization of unique and emerging technologies in new product categories.
Directing and setting priorities for teams focused on creating new ways to solve complex design and manufacturing challenges, cost reduction and yield improvement efforts, inventing and commercializing new technologies and methods.
Perform technical analyses, recommend, prepare and execute designs-of-experiments, and characterize process and design interactions.
Stay current and versed in emerging technologies, materials, methods and manufacturing processes.
Lead efforts within DfX and the hardware organization to define and evolve new internal methods, as well as generate and evangelize best practices guidelines to enable efficiencies in future hardware development and launch activities.
Drive DFM, activities in the hardware product development schedules to meet or exceed product targets (ex. Quality, reliability, safety, cost).
Proactively identify manufacturing processes and design methods which can be improved and then deliver best in-class solutions.
10-20% travel to domestic and overseas vendor and factory sites is required.
qualifications:
Bachelor / Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Industrial Engineering, or Material Science Engineering.
8+ years as either a Design for Manufacturing (DfM) or hardware engineer in product development for PCB and FPC design, or high-volume SMT / PCB manufacturing or process engineer.
Strong troubleshooting skills and structured problem-solving approach; Experience leveraging manufacturing data to identify design and assembly issues and subsequently drive continuous quality
Consistently demonstrating strong technical aptitude and experience with electro-mechanical design and related manufacturing process.  Some examples include: Design for assembly / Manufacturing; FPCA and PCBA design & SMT manufacturing; EE and ME component and material selection.
Concurrent engineering experience with cross-functional teams.
Demonstrated ability in product and statistical process control, part characterization, structured problem solving, defect/failure analysis, DOE, statistical data analysis.
Knowledge in 3D CAD systems like Pro-E/Creo, SolidWorks, Cadence Allegro, or Zuken is a plus.
Design for manufacturing (DfM) experience in a high-volume environment preferred.
Experience working on a team that is not centrally located.

description:
Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. We believe we should each find meaning in our work and we ensure employees have the freedom and the reach to help make a difference in the world.   
 We are looking for candidates who are:  
Team Players: driving digital transformation with our customers is a team sport. We need teammates who can stay maniacally focused on our customers' satisfaction while operating in a highly-collaborative, matrixed global organization.   
Growth Mindset: your life is truly about learning-it-all. You approach every new piece of information, knowledge, and competency with insatiable curiosity. Ultimately, you're open to the ideas of others, where the success of others does not diminish your own.   
Relentlessly Resourceful: you have the drive to overcome any obstacle in your work.   
Customer Obsessed: you learn about your customers and their businesses with a beginner's mind and then bring solutions that meet their needs.   
Pure Challenge: demonstrated desire and ability to readily take on complex challenges and work towards solutions to seemingly unsolvable problems.   
Passion for Technology: you're deeply motivated by the incredible opportunity of how technology can inspire and ignite change and renewal.   
 Curious about how a TECH giant like Microsoft finds/hires the best talents in the market? Consider recruiting as your future career, and want to experience working with (learning from) one of the best recruitment teams in the industry? 
 We may just have the internship for you. You’ll cover the basics of recruiting, but more importantly, gain knowledge to develop meaningful recruiting approaches which promote aggressive methods to source, evaluate, and pipeline both local and global technical candidates on requisition, project and event basis for Microsoft. You’re expected to thrive in the hunt and market intelligence and be focused on networking closely within the industry to identify the right talent and companies to target. A strong candidate for this role should demonstrate the ability to be result oriented, self- motivated individual. The ideal candidate will be curious, creative and has the ability to color outside the lines.

description: Hate Auth prompts? Come fix them! The Microsoft Edge Identity Team is focused on enabling seamless identity powered experiences. By integrating identity holistically into Edge, the team allows for numerous scenarios to be enhanced by user identity while preventing a proliferation of authorization prompts and focusing on Single Sign On (SSO). Because Microsoft Edge works across platforms, you’ll have the chance to find scalable ways to make this work on all of these platforms. You will expose identity to users in an intuitive manner.
responsibilities: You will work on enabling fluid identity scenarios that run across multiple platforms, from Windows to MacOS to Mobile to Linux! You’ll get a chance to measure the real-world impact of these changes by seeing how often users needlessly are prompted for credentials, and help define and implement protocols that eliminate that need. You’ll work in a variety of codebases to solve this problem, and have a chance to work with numerous partner teams to solve these problems. It’s a chance to work on a modern codebase with a fast iteration loop. You will get a chance to work in a number of languages, but a lot of the code is portable C++.
qualifications:
Preferred qualifications:
• Comfort in picking up new languages and tools as needed (e.g. Python, Typescript, web technologies).
• Demonstrated productivity and effectiveness in large codebases and/or open-source software (Chromium esp.).
• Experience in managing incoming and outgoing API design.
• Interest in web authentication stacks and protocols (e.g. OAuth).
• Familiarity working in an agile environment, attending daily standup. Experience with practicing role of scrum master is also helpful.

description:
We are looking for a SWE Manager to join our Microsoft Edge WebView2 team. Microsoft Edge represents a great growth opportunity for the company. We adopted the Chromium open-source project in the development of Microsoft Edge to create better web compatibility for our customers and reduce fragmentation for all web developers. description: The Microsoft map and geospatial team is one of the very few teams in the whole world that has the complete world wide geospatial data, and has the expertise on modeling, descripting, calculating and rendering the whole world. Our products include Azure Map, Bing Map and Windows Map app on both Windows and mobile platforms. You will have the rare opportunity to get in touch with the really “big” data for the whole world, and modify/transfer/summarize and search inside them to generate very useful mapping/routing/traffic/direction and local search features to help our customers in their daily life.
responsibilities:
- Ingest and process the map data from various sources to conform with Microsoft ontology, and process them into various downstream systems
- Be able to change, update, deploy and maintain the various sub-systems for Bing Map, Windows Map and Azure Map systems to keep our services alive and running better everyday
- Some of our team members are working on improving the local search experience including building state-of-art language models to categorize and understand the user queries and then generate the most relevant results to them in multiple languages
- Other part of our team members are working on the map mobile SDK for Windows, Android and iOS platforms, to render, search and navigate on those native platforms
- Remaining duties for the team includes owning and driving the improvement on all the map/local search sub-systems, including but not limit to map tile rendering, geocoding/reverse-geocoding, routing, traffic, turn-by-turn navigation, etc.
qualifications:
- Experienced in using at least two of the following languages: C++/C#/Java/ObjectC/Swift/Python/SQL
- Strong coding and problem-solving skills
- BS in Computer Science or Engineer or equivalent industry experience

Experience with at least one the following areas is a big plus:
- Good understanding of relational data and using the sql language to do the CRUD operations
- Mobile platform development experience on either Android or iOS with Java/ObjectC/Swift
- Industrial expertise on search engine, including knowledge on word breaker, LU, relevance, ranking, modeling, etc
- Good knowledge on the setup, deploy, monitoring and debugging huge online systems across multiple DCs

description:
Title: Senior dev/lead for MSNIA
 MSN Access team is responsible for maximizing the profitability of the MSN Dial-Up and MSN Premium business by maximizing customer retention, maintaining the core value proposition of the products over time, and sustained engineering to provide user secure and reliable internet access, mail, and browsing experiences. We are a team full of high caliber, talented, passionate developers from different regions around world. By leveraging modern client and font-end development techniques, we are working on a fast-cycle to delight our users, and meanwhile optimize engagement, revenue and retention for our product like MSN explorer.
 Now we are looking for a strong developer to join our fun and challenging journey. As a member of the MSN Access team, you'll have the opportunity to shape the design of MSN products, and have a direct impact on various products that millions of users use every day. You will learn and research many cutting edge methods in modern web techniques, client development. You will have enormous resources of Microsoft at your disposal and close collaborations with great teams and colleagues in world-wide. At the same time, you have the right environment and strong support to drive your favorite features to solution. We are an extremely agile team, and we move very fast from ideas to experimentation, development and deployment through continuous releases throughout the year.
responsibilities:
Implement MSN explorer client (including Chromium based web browser implementation, compatibility with Windows OS release, security updates etc.) and release thoughtful features.
Improve MSN internet access core services, web sites and partner interfaces.
Closely work with Devs and PMs in different countries to achieve fast collaboration and agile development.
qualifications:
We are looking for cream of the crop - motivated engineers with excellent architecture, design, coding, and debugging skills.
B.S. in Computer Science or related required.
Solid coding skill and familiar with at least one language: C++, HTML+JS.
Great design, problem solving, and data analysis skills, with demonstrated passion for quality, performance, and engineering excellence.
At least 1 year of industry experiences in Windows client application or Chromium based web browser developing is preferred.
Also willing to do modeling related works and base in Beijing is preferred.
Motivated and able to work independently as well in a collaborative team setting to research innovative solutions to challenging technical/business problems.

description:
Are you able to grasp complex system level issues and enjoy diving deeply into the analysis of specific engineering challenges? Do you enjoy working across disciplines, applying your engineering knowledge to understand and resolve design, sustainability, and manufacturing issues with a diverse engineering and business team? Do you thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment? If so, we would like you to join our team as we continue our successful launches of exciting next generation Microsoft hardware.
 The Microsoft New Product Introduction (NPI) group is looking for a passionate & team-oriented engineer to join us in shaping the future of devices.
 You will be part of the Design for Repair (DFR) team within NPI. Our team is focused on development of design & manufacturing solutions to enable repair of Microsoft products through close collaboration with hardware development and manufacturing teams early in the development cycle. This spans across mechanical design, materials, processes, and equipment affecting the product at system, sub-systems, and component levels. We drive our solutions through ideation, qualification, and implementation utilizing engineering proof of concepts, design of experiments, engineering & qualification builds, and ultimately mass production validation. As our products ramp into mass production, we own implementation of production repair, and identification and resolution of top repair & material scrap issues to meet product launch quality, continuity of supply, and cost metrics.
responsibilities:
As a Mechanical Engineer 2 (DFR), you will apply mechanical design expertise utilizing your manufacturing experience in both assembly and disassembly of hardware products. You are knowledgeable in technology, materials, and processes used in mechanical design and fabrication.
You have experience in hardware development and are cognizant of critical attributes required to characterize and qualify designs & processes at the System and Sub-System level.
Up to 25% international travel is required to accomplish critical objectives and guide contract manufacturing activities.
Those who are relentlessly curious, excellent communicators, and driven to continuously improve upon previous successes will excel within our team.
qualifications:
Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering or related engineering discipline
4+ years in an engineering role, directly contributing to the design or manufacture of products
Preferred additional Qualifications and Capabilities:
Experience with high volume consumer electronics desired
Understands PC or other consumer electronics mechanical and electro-mechanical interactions (enclosures, displays, thermal solutions, cables/FPCs, connectors, etc.)
Demonstrated proficiency of Six Sigma toolkit including statistical analysis, DOE, RCA, and DFX
Know-how with mechanical tolerance analysis and common engineering mechanical CAD tools, preferably Creo (SolidWorks, Creo, Pro/Engineer, or equivalent)
Experience with fixture & equipment development, metal forming & CNC, injection molding, adhesives, and complex mechanisms
Collaborates effectively within a cross-functional team to meet schedule, cost, and performance-related objectives
Self-manages daily and long-term activities, prioritizing activities and reviewing deliverables of a small engineering team
Communication skills are essential - must express technical concepts in verbal and written forms to peers and management

description: Hate Auth prompts? Come fix them! The Microsoft Edge Identity Team is focused on enabling seamless identity powered experiences. description:
Microsoft's mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more and we believe that artificial intelligence will play a critical role in accomplishing that mission. The Core Search and AI team is the leading applied machine learning team at Microsoft responsible for delivering the highest-quality experience to over 500M+ monthly active users around the world in Microsoft’s search engine, Bing. Beyond Bing other search engines such as Yahoo, DuckDuckGo, and new startups like Neeva depend on us as well. We have seen little innovation in search in the last decade and we are looking for people who want to build the next generation of search using advanced AI technologies such as deep learning.
 Our work spans a very large scope of scenarios including delivering high quality search results from a massive document corpus, extractive and abstractive summarization to generate document snippets, personalization, machine reading comprehension, and document recommendations. As a team, we leverage the diverse backgrounds and experiences of passionate engineers, scientists, and program managers to help us realize our goal of making the world smarter and more productive. We believe great products are built by inclusive teams of customer-obsessed individuals who trust each other and work closely together.  We collaborate regularly across the company both to find the technology breakthroughs from groups like Microsoft Research to infusing AI into the rest of Microsoft products like Office and Azure. If you are passionate about working on the latest and hottest areas that will help you develop skills in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, data science and high scale systems, this is the team you’re looking for!

description:
We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our Microsoft Edge WebView2 team.
Microsoft Edge represents a great growth opportunity for the company. We adopted the Chromium open-source project in the development of Microsoft Edge to create better web compatibility for our customers and reduce fragmentation for all web developers. With the first stable version that was first released in January 2020, we built a strong foundation that has been well received by the community. We are now on a journey to help deliver on unmet customer needs while contributing to the Chromium OSS project, in a way that helps us move the broader web forward.
The Edge Developer Experiences team is chartered to define and build the cross-platform web application story and developer tools for Microsoft Edge. An area this team focuses on is hybrid web applications that allow developers to take advantage of the best of what web and native technologies have to offer, in stitching together experiences for their customer needs. We respect choice in application technologies and already offer solutions for Win32, .NET and WinUI3.0 developers. We work closely with Windows, Office, Visual Studio, and other partner teams across the company, as well as the broader industry, to build the platform and tools that empower developers to build great end-to-end web-based experiences for end users. You can learn more about what our team is up to in our blog https://blogs.windows.com/msedgedev/!
As we bring new members into our team, we value individuals who are:
Focused on quality and delivering rapid success for customers
Creative, data driven and can incorporate industry and competitive knowledge to tackle complex problems
Self-starters who can think holistically and work independently
Able to operate effectively with ambiguity
Representatives of the Microsoft cultural attributes and leadership principles

Develop new capabilities in Microsoft Edge WebView2 with a focus on needs of our customers
Partner with program managers, designers, and data scientists to deliver a product that delights developers
Foster a collaborative relationship with partner teams and the developer community

description:
Do you want to be part of a team that brings world class hardware from concept to market? The Design for Excellence (DfX) team within Microsoft Device’s NPI group enables the delivery of next generation devices that our customers love, incorporating innovative, cutting edge technologies.
 Role & Opportunity:
The Microsoft New Product Introduction (NPI) group is looking for a passionate & team-oriented engineer to join us in shaping the future of devices.
 You will be part of the Design for Excellence (DfX) team that enables and delivers emerging technologies in new product categories. Your end-to-end engagement will include design development, new design and process characterization, and manufacturing launch of next generation Microsoft hardware.
You will get to collaborate cross-functionally with engineering disciplines across the company.
responsibilities:
Concurrently develop assembly processes and mechanical designs to enable internal product development groups in Surface Devices, Accessories, and Xbox product lines.
Collaborate with product development teams to identify design elements that are new, unique, or difficult and enable their realization through engineering validation cycles.
Partner with cross-functional teams and external vendors to define, characterize and deliver manufacturing processes that enable the commercialization of key product differentiators.
Direct activities to solve complex design and manufacturing challenges, support cost reduction and yield improvement efforts, invent and commercialize new technologies and manufacturing methods.

description:
We are looking for a [SWE/Program Manager] to join our Microsoft Edge WebView2 team. Microsoft Edge represents a great growth opportunity for the company. We adopted the Chromium open-source project in the development of Microsoft Edge to create better web compatibility for our customers and reduce fragmentation for all web developers. With the first stable version that was first released in January 2020, we built a strong foundation that has been well received by the community. We are now on a journey to help deliver on unmet customer needs while contributing to the Chromium OSS project, in a way that helps us move the broader web forward. The Edge Developer Experiences team is chartered to define and build the cross-platform web application story and developer tools for Microsoft Edge. An area this team focuses on is hybrid web applications that allow developers to take advantage of the best of what web and native technologies have to offer, in stitching together experiences for their customer needs. We respect choice in application technologies and already offer solutions for Win32, .NET and WinUI3.0 developers. We work closely with Windows, Office, Visual Studio, and other partner teams across the company, as well as the broader industry, to build the platform and tools that empower developers to build great end-to-end web-based experiences for end users. You can learn more about what our team is up to in our blog https://blogs.windows.com/msedgedev/! As we bring new members into our team, we value individuals who are:
• Focused on quality and delivering rapid success for customers

• Representatives of the Microsoft cultural attributes and leadership principles

description: The SharePoint Server team delivers a very popular platform that customers use to collaborate and solve complex business problems. Our hundreds of millions of customers, have complex compliance and/or feature needs that only we can meet. We are looking for great engineers who love creating and building things that delight and protect our customers. You will be working with a team of amazing engineers, PMs, and designers, and work closely with other teams across Microsoft to deliver large-scale, distributed architectures, and features to meet our customer’s needs. You would be a part of a team that is fundamentally changing the way that millions of people use their devices and interact with the most important content for their home, work, and school.

You will design and deliver services that manage internet-scale data stores, enable best-in-the-world file and site browsing and editing performance, or add innovative features to how people manage and interact with their data. Given the scope of SharePoint Server, we have positions that range from the very front-end of how a customer interacts with our services, through core system logic, to mega-scale storage, to the platform that engineers around the world use to build and maintain them. description:
We are looking for a Principal Program Manager/Senior Program Manager to join our Microsoft Edge WebView2 team. 
 Microsoft Edge represents a great growth opportunity for the company. We adopted the Chromium open-source project in the development of Microsoft Edge to create better web compatibility for our customers and reduce fragmentation for all web developers. With the first stable version that was first released in January 2020, we built a strong foundation that has been well received by the community. We are now on a journey to help deliver on unmet customer needs while contributing to the Chromium OSS project, in a way that helps us move the broader web forward. 
 The Edge Developer Experiences team is chartered to define and build the cross-platform web application story and developer tools for Microsoft Edge. An area this team focuses on is hybrid web applications that allow developers to take advantage of the best of what web and native technologies have to offer, in stitching together experiences for their customer needs. We respect choice in application technologies and already offer solutions for Win32, .NET and WinUI3.0 developers. We work closely with Windows, Office, Visual Studio, and other partner teams across the company, as well as the broader industry, to build the platform and tools that empower developers to build great end-to-end web-based experiences for end users. You can learn more about what our team is up to in our blog https://blogs.windows.com/msedgedev/!

 We are looking for a strong developer with lead potential or experience to join our fun and challenging journey.

responsibilities:

• Working with services spanning thousands of servers , doing tens of billions of transactions and serving hundreds of millions of users

description:
SharePoint Server
 The SharePoint Server team delivers a very popular platform that customers use to collaborate and solve complex business problems. Our hundreds of millions of customers, have complex compliance and/or feature needs that only we can meet. We are looking for great engineers who love creating and building things that delight and protect our customers. You will be working with a team of amazing engineers, PMs, and designers, and work closely with other teams across Microsoft to deliver large-scale, distributed architectures, and features to meet our customer’s needs. You would be a part of a team that is fundamentally changing the way that millions of people use their devices and interact with the most important content for their home, work, and school.
responsibilities:
You will work on large-scale distributed systems that are critical for customers around the world. You will design and deliver services that manage internet-scale data stores, enable best-in-the-world file and site browsing and editing performance, or add innovative features to how people manage and interact with their data. Given the scope of SharePoint Server, we have positions that range from the very front-end of how a customer interacts with our services, through core system logic, to mega-scale storage, to the platform that engineers around the world use to build and maintain them. Everything you do will be supported by a world-class engineering team.
 As an engineer in our team, you will contribute to and help shape the vibrant, inclusive engineering culture of OneDrive & SharePoint. You will be expected to do deep, data-driven, collaborative design for additions and changes to our products. You will write clean, efficient code and comprehensive tests. And you will deliver features that will be used by hundreds of millions of customers around the world.

description: Hate Auth prompts? Come fix them! The Microsoft Edge Identity Team is focused on enabling seamless identity powered experiences. By integrating identity holistically into Edge, the team allows for numerous scenarios to be enhanced by user identity while preventing a proliferation of authorization prompts and focusing on Single Sign On (SSO). Because Microsoft Edge works across platforms, you’ll have the chance to find scalable ways to make this work on all of these platforms. You will expose identity to users in an intuitive manner.
responsibilities: You will work on enabling fluid identity scenarios that run across multiple platforms, from Windows to MacOS to Mobile to Linux! You’ll get a chance to measure the real-world impact of these changes by seeing how often users needlessly are prompted for credentials, and help define and implement protocols that eliminate that need. You’ll work in a variety of codebases to solve this problem, and have a chance to work with numerous partner teams to solve these problems. It’s a chance to work on a modern codebase with a fast iteration loop. You will get a chance to work in a number of languages, but a lot of the code is portable C++.
qualifications:

• Must have 2+ years experience in C/C++ or modern programming languages with solid engineering practices

description:
We are looking for a [SWE/Program Manager] to join our Microsoft Edge WebView2 team. Microsoft Edge represents a great growth opportunity for the company. We adopted the Chromium open-source project in the development of Microsoft Edge to create better web compatibility for our customers and reduce fragmentation for all web developers. With the first stable version that was first released in January 2020, we built a strong foundation that has been well received by the community. We are now on a journey to help deliver on unmet customer needs while contributing to the Chromium OSS project, in a way that helps us move the broader web forward. The Edge Developer Experiences team is chartered to define and build the cross-platform web application story and developer tools for Microsoft Edge. An area this team focuses on is hybrid web applications that allow developers to take advantage of the best of what web and native technologies have to offer, in stitching together experiences for their customer needs. We respect choice in application technologies and already offer solutions for Win32, .NET and WinUI3.0 developers. We work closely with Windows, Office, Visual Studio, and other partner teams across the company, as well as the broader industry, to build the platform and tools that empower developers to build great end-to-end web-based experiences for end users. You can learn more about what our team is up to in our blog https://blogs.windows.com/msedgedev/! As we bring new members into our team, we value individuals who are:
• Focused on quality and delivering rapid success for customers
• Creative, data driven and can incorporate industry and competitive knowledge to tackle complex problems
• Self-starters who can think holistically and work independently
• Able to operate effectively with ambiguity
• Representatives of the Microsoft cultural attributes and leadership principles
responsibilities:
As part of the Microsoft Edge team, you will work on making the web platform available to developers in their native applications. Together we will:
• Develop new capabilities in Microsoft Edge WebView2 with a focus on needs of our customers
• Partner with program managers, designers, and data scientists to deliver a product that delights developers
• Foster a collaborative relationship with partner teams and the developer community
qualifications:
• Web technologies, including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
• Windows app development
• Multi- threaded application development
• Mac or Linux OS development experience

description: Microsoft Outlook Mobile is changing how the world works through mobile email. As professionals continue making the leap to mobile, we empower them to be more responsive and get more done from anywhere. In a world where more than half of email messages are first read on a mobile device, it’s essential to give people fantastic email experiences wherever they go. The Outlook Mobile team is passionate about this quest and the Outlook Mobile app for iOS and Android provides innovative ways to focus on what’s important in your inbox, to schedule meetings, and work with attachments and files.
responsibilities:
We are looking for a Program Manager to join our product engineering team here in Suzhou, China who will help us define and lead key innovative product experiences that users will love and IT will trust. We work iteratively, ship often, and put the user first. We want to delight our users with experiences that help them focus and be the most productive they can be at work and in life, while on the go, all while achieving our business goals that keep the lights on.
 The challenges are big and so are the opportunities for impact you’ll have. Outlook is one of Microsoft’s most important businesses. It’s the premium Microsoft brand for communications and time management, and a key part of our One Microsoft strategy. Outlook for iOS and Android are at the center of it all! 
 We have: 
- An awesome opportunity to tackle unique and large product and business challenges
- Diverse backgrounds, opinions, previous work histories, and experiences that translate into an exciting and resourceful cross-functional team across different office locations and time zones.
- A growth mindset and a craving for building the best mobile product in the app stores!
qualifications:
- A growth mindset, too. 
- Demonstrated excellence building polished user experiences that people love.   
- Have a sense of pride and personal accountability for end-to-end quality, completeness, and resulting user experience.
- Proven ability to influence and drive strategy at product level scope.   
- Establish strong collaboration partnership and trust with local and global engineering stakeholders with outstanding cross-discipline and cross-team collaboration skills.

description:

 As a Senior Designer, you will play a critical role in the product making process for Outlook experiences.

description:
Internet search is one of the highest impact and most technically challenging projects in the computer industry. Answers Ranking (AR) team in Bing is responsible for optimizing various answers placement in Bing search result page to deliver most relevant results to users. We owns mainline answer ranking, answer arbitration, defect suppression, metric definition, and other whole page ranking scenarios. We are a team full of high caliber, talented, passionate developers from different regions around world.
 Now we are looking for strong developers to join our fun and challenging journey.  As a member of the AR team, you will have a direct impact on the quality of our search results which in turn determines the experience of millions of user searches every day. We explore and invent cutting edge methods in statistics, information retrieval, data mining, machine learning,  and distributed systems to solve hard problems. You will have enormous resources at your disposal; high-performance distributed systems with vast amounts (peta-bytes) of raw and processed data from our logs/index and the tools to work with this data. At the same time you will be working with low-level systems code to maximize our relevance while keeping user latencies at a minimum. You will have an opportunity to make a huge difference not only to Microsoft’s online business and bottom line, but to enhance search experience to allow everyone to find the information they need. You have the right environment and strong support to drive your favorite features to solution.
